info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued June 16 at 5:17PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MDT FRIDAY... The New Mexico Departments of Health and Environment has issued an Air Quality Alert, until 1 PM MDT Friday. An Air Quality Alert for Smoke has been issued. * WHAT... Winds will be out of the south-southeast sustained around 15 mph and gusts up to 30 mph in certain areas. Smoke from the Black Fire and Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon Fire will tend to drift toward the north-northwest through the remainder of the afternoon and evening. The variable wind conditions in the vicinity of the Black Fire can cause the smoke to drift to the areas in western part of New Mexico around Reserve. Overnight smoke maybe seen around Caballo and Truth or Consequences. Impacts from Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon Fire will be moderate and smoke maybe visible with periods of moderate to unhealthy in Taos, Mora, Angel Fire, Sapello, and Las Vegas. * WHERE... Moderate to unhealthy smoke impacts can be seen across portions of Taos and Mora County. Elsewhere, brief moderate impacts possible at times but widespread unhealthy conditions are not expected. More details and latest air quality information can be found at https://fire.airnow.gov * WHEN... Remainder of this afternoon through at least 1pm MDT Friday, June 17th.
